ingredients.ingredient: 1 cup mayonnaise, or more to taste

cookingTips: Thaw the peas thoroughly under cold running water and drain well to prevent excess moisture from making the salad watery
Finely chop the almonds and onion into similar-sized pieces for even flavor distribution and better texture throughout the salad
Start with 3/4 cup of mayonnaise and add more gradually while mixing to achieve your preferred creaminess rather than oversaturating the salad
Refrigerate for at least 1-2 hours before serving to allow flavors to meld and for the salad to reach optimal serving temperature
enrichment.coachingPrompt: I'm making a Pea Salad that serves 10 people and needs to be ready in under 30 minutes. Please guide me through: 1) The best technique for thawing frozen petite peas in a colander without making them mushy, 2) How to properly chop 6 ounces of smoked almonds and 1 onion finely and evenly, 3) The correct method for folding 1 cup of mayonnaise and black pepper into the pea mixture to ensure even coating without overmixing, 4) Tips for achieving the right creamy consistency if needed, and 5) Proper chilling time and serving suggestions. Please include timing for each step.
